Title: Lead Software Engineer
Description: * At Cox Automotive, our engineers and technologists are literally changing the way people buy, sell and use cars. With operations across five continents and brands like Autotrader and Kelly Blue Book in our family, we have the reach to make this transformation happen in new and exciting ways. From browsing to test driving, purchasing to servicing, we’re taking charge to create the future of automotive. We’ve got some of the most robust data in the industry, so our big data insights can lead to some pretty amazing software creations. * And now, we’re building a future that is autonomous, connected, electric and shared. And you could make this a reality. All while working in an environment that puts collaboration and culture at the forefront of everything we do. * What You’ll Do * You’ll rely on strong leadership skills to make decisions, support your vision, influence your team and earn their trust. *  You’ll work cross functionally with other engineers and analysts to make sure everything we deliver is of the highest caliber. Your efforts will pave the way for consumers, dealers and lenders to seamlessly transact by providing secure, reliable and easy ways to manage the entire life cycle of a digital contract. *  You will drive the engineering solutions for the projects you’re spearheading, guiding the technical direction of your scrum team. You will also work to influence the technical direction across teams collaborating on high-impact projects. *  You’ll work with our engineers, guiding and coaching them so they grow, learning about their challenges and helping them emerge as even stronger coders and tech leaders. *  You’ll expect quality in everything you and your team do, while embracing a spirit of agility and creativity. You’ll always be looking for ways we can improve, and you’ll ask all the right questions to find better ways to get things done. *  You’ll rely on your exceptional technology, process, and people skills to resolve issues, create transformative products and drive positive change. You understand security always needs to be top-of-mind, and you’ll make sure your scrum team walks the walk with standards and guidelines. * What’s In It For You? * We want you to feel cared for and respected (like you do with our customers), and that starts with Cox’s highly competitive pay and other compensation perks (401k + company matching, comprehensive medical benefits, etc.). We also offer discounted Cox services, tuition reimbursement for academic pursuits, adoption assistance, paid time off to volunteer, childcare and eldercare resources, pet insurance and much more. *  Good work should be rewarded, and not just with a healthy paycheck. And while we may be innovation obsessed, we never forget that we are human powered. So, it’s our goal to make sure you feel recognized for your contributions. It’s also important to work alongside colleagues who “get you.” At Cox, you will find a workplace where relationships are crafted with care and successes are celebrated with high fives. We strive to create an environment where you can do you, and everyone from leadership to new hires can support and feel supported. *  We know you’re always looking for growth and the opportunity to learn new things. At Cox Automotive, you’ll have all kinds of opportunities to expand your expertise and grow your skills in ways that will challenge and empower you. And in the future, you may have the opportunity to drive innovation in other sectors where the Cox family of brands operates like cleantech, health care and esports. *  You’ll also get to work with a wide range of products and technologies across the Cox Automotive ecosystem, allowing you to have a hands-on experience in transforming an industry. We don’t believe in limitations, only possibilities. Our technological capabilities combined with your wisdom and wizardry will allow us to grow the good and drive incredible innovation. *  You’ll work alongside fantastic people who want to see you succeed. At Cox, we are eternal optimists and we strive to bring out the best in everyone. Our beliefs, our ways of working and lifting each other up, our knowledge, and our commitment to people and purpose all form a cultural fabric that is remarkably flexible, but extraordinarily strong. *  You’ll quite literally have an opportunity to make the world a better place. That may sound like hyperbole, but it’s true. Across the Cox family of businesses, we’ve launched a movement to positively impact 34 million lives by 2034 in areas like technology access and education, social equity, and environmental sustainability through a wide range of company programs, partnerships and employee volunteer opportunities. * Who You Are * You are curious, open-minded and optimistic. A real go-getter. You welcome new ideas and people who are different from you, and you’re ready to make your mark at a company that is building a brighter future for the next generation. *  You’ve got a bachelor’s degree, most likely in Computer Science or Engineering. *  You’ve got at least two years’ experience with AWS and have worked intimately with AWS cloud native applications. *  You’re a polyglot, someone who is comfortable with a variety of programming languages. Our stack is primarily .NET Core, with DynamoDB as our traditional data store and React for our user interfaces. AWS serving as our cloud provider, which allows us to focus on and leverage serverless technologies. *  You’ve got some history with implementing CI/CD pipelines, docker containers, and blue/green deployments, as well as creating and deploying scalable API’s leveraging API gateways. *  You’re comfortable breaking a monolithic application down into smaller services. *  You’ll often hear differing opinions, and you’ll show that you can change your opinion when new information comes along that changes the dynamic. Your courage and natural humility will be on full display when you make a mistake by owning it and then learning from it. *  You comfortable in areas like network, storage, infrastructure or security. In fact, you may even be a “full stack engineer,” not limited to programming languages.*  To be employed in this role, you’ll need to clear a pre-employment background check and drug test. Cox Automotive does not currently consider a pre-employment drug test for marijuana for this position. However, we are a drug-free workplace, so the possession, use or being under the influence of drugs illegal under federal or state law during work hours, on company property and/or in company vehicles is prohibited.* About Cox Automotive *  At Cox Automotive, people of every background are driven by their passion for mobility, innovation and community. We transform the way the world buys, sells, owns and uses cars, accelerating the industry with global powerhouse brands like Autotrader, Kelley Blue Book, Manheim and more. What’s more, we do it all with an emphasis on employee growth and happiness. Drive your future forward and join Cox Automotive today! *  About Cox *  Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses – which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications – is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today! *  - *  Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). With local management teams at the helm in 11 western states, Zions is dedicated to making a difference in their local communities. * We are transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. We operate in a fast-paced, information-driven environment, which means we need people who bring diverse experiences, perspectives, and expertise to meet ever-changing demands. Your ability to adapt, learn innovate and collaborate with a dynamic team helps us provide exceptional service to our customers and communities. * ETO is committed to helping our employees grow, develop, and advance in their career. Our Workforce of the Future, DEI and Upskilling initiatives allow you to network across the organization, volunteer in our community, and build your technical and soft skills. We believe that investing in your success and well-being is an investment in our customers and our business. * Together we are building a culture that values diversity, celebrates growth and creates a space of belonging for all our team members. Our people are what set us apart and make us great. * Zions is seeking a Business Analyst * We are currently looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team. As a Business Analyst, you will be critical to the success of our CORE Deposits Transformation. In this role you will gather metrics related to the work product of the finance recon requirements, working closely with our business users, project management, and stakeholders. T he successful candidate will want to be part of a motivated and driven team and work with respected leaders. Someone who is proactive, has a great attitude, is confident, and wants to inspire others to achieve bank initiatives. * Responsibilities * Develop user documentation, writing requirements for reporting and metrics related to recon efforts * Perform and participate in the analysis, design and implementation of business processes and procedures specifically related to reconciliation of accounts. * Perform application troubleshooting and the coordination of incident resolution. Work with end users or vendors for problem resolution and make recommendations for improvements. * Be responsible to facilitate new or enhanced change management requests and post change validations related to metrics gathering and performance monitoring. * Conduct user acceptance testing or test planning sessions. * Act as a liaison to various departments, management, and staff to resolve problems and improve processes and procedures. * Qualifications * 4+ years’ experience in business analysis, processes, procedures, project management, multiple technologies, frameworks, etc. or other directly related experience. * Requires a bachelor's degree in computer science, business, finance, or a related field. A combination of education and experience may meet requirements. * Solid analytical, organizational, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills. * Solid presentation, technical and non-technical communication skills, both verbal and written. * In depth banking and related finance experience is a plus. * Experience with Agile project methodology, or similar, is preferred. * Solid interpersonal skills with the ability to work with both management and staff employees. * Location and Flexibility * This opportunity will be in our brand-new Zions Technology Center in Midvale, UT. We have a hybrid schedule of 3 days in the office and 2 days at home if you are within the Salt Lake City area. * The Zions Technology Center is a 400,000-square-foot technology campus in Midvale, Utah. Located on the former Sharon Steel Mill superfund site, the sustainably built campus will be the company’s primary technology and operations center. This modern and environmentally friendly technology center will enable Zions to continue to compete for the best technology talent in the state while providing team members with an exceptional work environment with features such as: * Electric vehicle charging stations and close proximity to Historic Gardner Village UTA TRAX station. * At least 75% of the building is powered by on-site renewable solar energy. * Access to outdoor recreation, parks, trails, shareable bikes and locker rooms. * Large modern cafe with a healthy and diverse menu. * Healthy indoor environment with ample natural light and fresh air. * LEED-certified sustainable building that features include the use of low VOC-emitting construction material
